instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
A small amount of water got into the charge port.

The laptop no longer turns on, no fan spin, no display. The photo shows the damage to the charge port. If I replace the port will this fix the issue.

I have a multimeter if that helps... I'm not too sure how to use it though so will need some help

There was also a small amount of corrosion on the board near the charge port .... I have cleaned this off with some isopropyl alcohol

Thank you in advance!
[ATTACH type="full" alt="IMG_20200910_200133__01__01.jpg"]59437[/ATTACH]

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message: There was also a small amount of corrosion on the board near the charge port .... I have cleaned this off with some isopropyl alcohol

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

That looks ugly, possibly spikes from VBUS to data lines.
You should check voltage and diode mode on all power rails; starting with PPBUS_G3H and 3V3_G3H.
And need USB-C meter to check input voltage.

Also need 820-xxxx board code, to see if any schematic is available...

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
Hi! Thanks for the reply.

I have ordered myself a USB-C meter.

I'm not sure where to find the board number.. where about a would it be located.

I do own a multimeter, but I will need help on how to use it if that's ok?

Kind regards

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
We first need to locate a schematic, if available.
Sometime doesn't exist and need to use another, closer possible.
Check on Internet pictures for 820-00850, 820-01041 and compare with your board.

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
It looks like it's a 820-00850. 

I have tested it with the USBC meter and the photo attached is what I get.

I have replaced the USBC port and put everything back.

It still doesn't boot and no fan spin. But I get 20 volts from the charger.

Are you able to help ?

Kind regards

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message: This it the readout I get from each side

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
Post exact PPBUS_G3H voltage (no battery).
Do you get 3V3_S5?

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
Hey how do I do that? 

I have a multi-meter .. what setting do I need to use

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
I have the boardview schematic now I can see where ppbus_g3h is. Do I need to measure the voltage? If so how do I do that

I have discord  as well if you wanted to add me... Dan H#3836

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message: I asked about voltage, so yes; check on DC voltmeter mode...

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message: Hi PPBUS_G3H seems to be 0.203 V to ground

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
So no voltage at F7000.
What is the exact voltage at R7020?

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message: R7020 is 20V to ground .. kind regards

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message: I didn't realise that I needed the charger plugged in .... PPBUS-G3H is 12.5 volts to ground.

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
I have gone through all of PPBUS_G3H and cant see any short on it. Been through them all on resistance mode. They are all 10+ at 200k setting.

F7000 has no short 

R7020 has no short

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
You cannot have any short on PPBUS_G3H if gets 12.5V.
And do not waste time measuring the same rail in different points; how can you think will get different values???

Do you get any voltage at L7600/60?
Any pulse at least?

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
L7600 has 5.5 volts 

and L7660 has 3.3 volts to ground

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
Then you should have more voltages on the board.
Post them for all big coils...

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message: What are the coils sorry ?

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message: Something like L7600/60; bigger, or not...

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message: Ah ok..  will take me a while.. I'll let you know tomorrow

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
I have checked all of them and the only one that has voltage is L7030 = 10Volts 

the rest have 0 volts. 

kind regards

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message:
Check exact ohm value of R7020.
A multimeter is much better than the eye...

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message: The resistance of R7020 is 60 ohm

threads.title: Mid 2018 A1989 very small amount of water damage
threads.message: Really bad, change it; must be 10 miliohm...
